form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Received; read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

form.official-title: To amend the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act to make technical corrections to the hazard mitigation revolving loan fund program, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Safeguarding Tomorrow through Ongoing Risk Mitigation Technical Corrections Act.

section.header: Technical corrections to hazard mitigation revolving loan fund program
section.text: Section 205 of the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act (42 U.S.C. 5135) is amended—

clause.text: at the end of subparagraph (A), by adding and; and
at the end of subparagraph (B), by striking ; and and inserting a period;

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (3)(D), by striking local governments, insular areas, and Indian tribal governments and inserting local governments and Tribal governments; and

clause.text: by redesignating subparagraphs (C) through (D) as subparagraphs (B) through (C), respectively; and
in the paragraph heading, by striking establishing and inserting implementing;
by striking establish and inserting implement;
by inserting , including any amendments made by State, local, Tribal, or territorial governments to such codes, specifications, and standards, after standards; and

subparagraph.text: by striking paragraph (3) and inserting the following:

paragraph.text: The term eligible entity means a State or an Indian tribal government that has received a major disaster declaration pursuant to section 401.

subparagraph.text: by redesignating paragraphs (6) through (9) as paragraphs (5) through (8), respectively; and

attestation-group.attestation-date: Passed the House of Representatives March 30, 2022.
